title: Final Review & Exam Preparation
description: Comprehensive spiral review across all Pre-Calculus content areas: functions and transformations, polynomial/rational functions, exponential/logarithmic functions, trigonometry, analytic geometry, vectors, sequences/series, and limits. Focus on synthesis, connections between topics, and exam readiness.
goals: Synthesize function analysis across all families: polynomial, rational, exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric.
Integrate trigonometric concepts: identities, equations, applications, inverse functions, Law of Sines/Cosines.
Connect analytic geometry, parametric, polar, vectors, and complex numbers.
Apply sequences/series and limits as a bridge to calculus thinking.
instructionalStrategy: AI-led comprehensive review using diagnostic-driven focus areas
Mixed-topic problem sets to build fluency switching between concepts
Emphasis on multi-step problems requiring multiple skill integration

scaffold.title: Review Block A: Functions & Transformations
scaffold.content: Review of all function families and their properties, transformations, composition, and inverses.
keyPoints: Parent functions: linear, quadratic, cubic, absolute value, square root, rational (1/x), exponential, logarithmic.
Transformations: g(x) = af(b(x-c))+d. Vertical stretch/shrink (a), horizontal stretch/shrink (1/b), shifts (c, d), reflections.
Composition: (f∘g)(x) = f(g(x)). Domain: all x in domain of g where g(x) is in domain of f.
Inverse: f⁻¹ exists if f is one-to-one. Reflect over y=x. f(f⁻¹(x))=x.
Polynomial: end behavior, zeros, multiplicity, turning points. Rational: asymptotes, holes.
Exponential: y=abˣ growth/decay. Logarithmic: inverse of exponential, properties/laws.

scaffold.title: Review Block A: Mixed Function Problems

problems.problem: Sketch the key features of f(x) = (2x²-8)/(x²-x-6). Find all asymptotes, intercepts, and holes.

scaffold.title: Review Block B: Trigonometry Comprehensive
scaffold.content: Review of all trig concepts: unit circle, graphs, identities, equations, inverse trig, law of sines/cosines.
keyPoints: Unit circle: exact values for π/6, π/4, π/3 and all quadrants. ASTC rule.
Graphs: y=Asin(B(x-C))+D. Amplitude |A|, period 2π/B, phase C, midline D.
Identities: Pythagorean, reciprocal, quotient, sum/difference, double/half-angle.
Solving: isolate trig function, find reference angle, apply quadrant, check interval.
Inverse trig: restricted domains. arcsin[-π/2,π/2], arccos[0,π], arctan(-π/2,π/2).
Law of Sines: a/sinA=b/sinB. SSA ambiguous case. Law of Cosines: a²=b²+c²-2bc·cosA.

scaffold.title: Review Block B: Mixed Trig Problems

problems.problem: Triangle has a=7, b=10, C=40°. Find c and the area.

scaffold.title: Review Block C: Analytic Geometry, Vectors & Complex Numbers
scaffold.content: Review of conics, parametric/polar, vectors, and complex numbers in polar form.
keyPoints: Conics: identify from general second-degree equation. Complete the square to find standard form.
Parabola: (x-h)²=4p(y-k). Ellipse: c²=a²-b². Hyperbola: c²=a²+b².
Parametric: eliminate parameter via substitution or trig identity.
Polar: x=rcosθ, y=rsinθ, r²=x²+y². Curves: roses, limaçons, cardioids, lemniscates.
Vectors: dot product for angle/orthogonality/projection. Work=F·d.
Complex: z=r·cis(θ). DeMoivre's: zⁿ=rⁿcis(nθ). nth roots: n equally spaced.

scaffold.title: Review Block C: Mixed Analytic/Vector Problems

problems.problem: Find the angle between u=⟨2, -5⟩ and v=⟨4, 1⟩. Then find proj_v(u).
Find all square roots of z = -2+2√3i in rectangular form.

scaffold.title: Review Block D: Sequences, Series & Limits
scaffold.content: Review of sequences, series, and limits as preparation for calculus.
keyPoints: Arithmetic: aₙ=a₁+(n-1)d, Sₙ=n/2(a₁+aₙ). Geometric: aₙ=a₁rⁿ⁻¹, Sₙ=a₁(1-rⁿ)/(1-r).
Infinite geometric: S=a₁/(1-r) for |r|<1.
Limits: direct substitution first. If 0/0: factor, rationalize, simplify.
Continuity: f(c) defined, limit exists, limit=f(c).
Limits at infinity: compare degrees for rational functions.
Connection: infinite series = limit of partial sums.

scaffold.title: Review Block D: Mixed Sequences/Limits Problems

problems.answer: Multiply by conjugate: (√(4x²+1)-2x)(√(4x²+1)+2x)/(√(4x²+1)+2x) = (4x²+1-4x²)/(√(4x²+1)+2x) = 1/(√(4x²+1)+2x). As x→∞: √(4x²+1)≈2x, so denominator→4x→∞. Limit=0.

answerKeys.rev-rational: Hole(-2,8/5). VA x=3. HA y=2. x-int x=2. y-int 4/3.
